duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise teams of Operators and Technicians in Outside Plant (OSP) construction activities.
Prepare logistics plans and coordinate mobilization to and from work locations.
Drive safety culture, including safety standards, personal protective equipment, and best practices.
Schedule and coordinate deliveries, purchase of materials, and work with inter-departmental team members to drive favorable financial outcomes.
Perform onsite training, formulate processes and procedures, and ensure compliance with construction standards.
Read and interpret engineering designs and construction drawings, provide support to monitor and report Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Maintain construction materials inventory and coordinate re-stocking, develop and coach team, supervise 24/7 maintenance activities.
Oversee site construction, schedule management, resources, safety practices, and compliance with permitting requirements.
Ensure all work is completed in accordance with construction standards, processes, and procedures.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent required
Valid driver's license required - DOT/ CDL preferred
OSHA 10 required, OSHA 30 or greater preferred
